intro: Quelchia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted quelchia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Quelchia bracteata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and stream banks.
